name: High Altitude Green Beans
description: Buy green Cloud Coffee specialty beans from 1100-1800 MASL.

name: Guatemala - Rio Azul 1800 MASL (1Kg)
description:
2013-2014 Huhtamaki NZ Coffee Awards: Best NZ Espresso!

In the mountains of Huehuetenango between 1600-1800 Metres Above Sea Level (MASL) grows this fine high altitude coffee. The Microclimate near Rio Azul ensures that this Strictly Hard Bean (SHB) coffee is of the same optimum quality each harvest. The rarified air, sunny days and misty nights ensures that this coffee has the right elements to give you a fresh cup of coffee every time.

The Coffee: Floral and clean with citric acidity and a smooth mouthfeel

* 100% single origin Arabica coffee beans

* Sourced from a Co-operative of small farmers

* Roasted in New Zealand by an award winning roaster

name: Brazil - Carmo de Minas (1Kg)
description:
In the mountainous region of Carmo de Minas at an average of 1100 Metres Above Sea Level (MASL) grows this fine coffee. These High Altitude coffee beans grow in the purest of environments where clean air, tropical rainfall and fertile soil ensures that the best flavours are locked in each harvest. High Altitude coffee plants produce less coffee, however the higher density of each bean ensures a purer more flavoursome cup of Coffee.

The Coffee: Has balanced mouthfeel with peanut brittle and citrus flavours.

* 100% single origin Arabica coffee beans

* Sourced from a Co-operative of small farmers

* Roasted in New Zealand by an award winning roaster
